definition: A term used to express a specific purpose or intention, often indicating a means to achieve a desired outcome or goal. It is commonly employed to establish a connection between actions, events, or circumstances, highlighting the relationship between them.

examples.german: Ich gehe einkaufen, damit ich Essen für die Woche habe.
examples.english: I'm going shopping so that I have food for the week.

examples.german: Er hat viel gelernt, damit er die Prüfung besteht.
examples.english: He studied a lot so that he passes the exam.

examples.german: Sie hat das Buch gekauft, damit sie es lesen kann.
examples.english: She bought the book so that she can read it.

examples.german: Wir müssen früh aufstehen, damit wir den Zug nicht verpassen.
examples.english: We have to wake up early so that we don't miss the train.

examples.german: Er hat hart gearbeitet, damit er befördert wird.
examples.english: He worked hard so that he gets promoted.
